content:
ADDENDUM II TO THE PLAN OF OPERATIONS FOR THE PRODUCTION OF TRIPLE VACCINE IN TAIWAN PROVINCE OF THE REPUBLIC OF CHINA TO IMPLEMENT A MASS IMMUNIZATION CAMPAIGN AGAINST DIPHTHERIA, TETANUS AND PERTUSSIS
The Government of the Republic of China, hereinafter referred to as "The Government ", and the World Health Organization, hereinafter referred to as " The Organization", and the United Nations Children's Fund, hereinafter referred to as "UNICEF", have agreed to the following Addendum to the Plan of Operations for the Provision of Equipment and Supplies by UNICEF, for the Production of Triple Vaccine in Taiwan Province of the Republic of China to implement a Mass Immunization Campaign against Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis, signed by the Government on 1 June 1953, by the Organization on 18 May 1953, and by UNICEF on 4 May 1953, and to the Addendum I to thet Plan of Operations, signed by the Government on November 1954, by the Organization on November 1954, and by UNICEF on November 1954.
0025
1. On the recommendation of the Organization's expert who inspected the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory, Shihlin, Taipei Hsien, in June 1954, UNICEF has agreed to provide additional equipment for this laboratory, considered to be necessary in order to permit the production of suffi- cient triple vaccine to undertake the mass immunization campaign as set forth in the Plan of Operations, and particularly in the Addendum I thereto. The report of the expert is dated 20 June 1954 and should be read in connection with this Addendum II.
2. In addition to its commitments as set forth in the Plan of Operations, UNICEF will therefore provide the following, up to a value of $13,200 (including $1,200 estimated freight charges) :
Room air conditioners, germicidal lamps, heaters and thermostat unit for incubator room, culture flasks, miscellaneous equipment and chemicals sterilizer, filtering apparatus.
3. The Government agrees that this equipment will be installed within one month of its arrival in Taiwan, and that, within 6 months thereafter, production of sufficient triple vaccine to maintain the mass immunization program at the level specified in the Plan of Operations and the Addendum I thersto will begin, and will be maintained for as long as is necessary to complete the mass immuni- zation program. Thereafter sufficient vaccine will be produced for continued immunization operations as specified in the Plan of Operations and the Addendum I thereto.
國史饭 Academia Historica
21

FOR THE PRODUCTION OF TRIPLE VACCINE IN
TAIWAN PROVINCE OF THE REPUBLIC OF CHINA TO IMPLEMENT A
MASS IMMUNIZATION CAMPAIGN AGAINST DIPHTHERIA, TETANUS AND PERTUSSIS
The Government of the Republic of China, hereinafter referred to as "The
Government ", and the World Health Organization, hereinafter referred to
as " The Organization", and the United Nations Children's Fund, hereinafter
referred to as "UNICEF", have agreed to the following Addendum to the
Plan of Operations for the Provision of Equipment and Supplies by UNICEF,
for the Production of Triple Vaccine in Taiwan Province of the Republic of
China to implement a Mass Immunization Campaign against Diphtheria, Tetanus
and Pertussis, signed by the Government on 1 June 1953, by the Organization
on 18 May 1953, and by UNICEF on 4 May 1953, and to the Addendum I to thet
Plan of Operations, signed by the Government on November 1954, by the
Organization on November 1954, and by UNICEF on November 1954.
1. On the recommendation of the Organization's expert who inspected the
Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory, Shihlin, Taipei Hsien, in June 1954,
UNICEF has agreed to provide additional equipment for this laboratory,
considered to be necessary in order to permit the production of suffi-
cient triple vaccine to undertake the mass immunization campaign as
set forth in the Plan of Operations, and particularly in the Addendum
I thereto. The report of the expert is dated 20 June 1954 and should
be read in connection with this Addendum II.
2. In addition to its commitments as set forth in the Plan of Operations,
UNICEF will therefore provide the following, up to a value of $13,200
(including $1,200 estimated freight charges) :
Room air conditioners, germicidal lamps, heaters and thermostat
unit for incubator room, culture flasks, miscellaneous equipment
and chemicals sterilizer, filtering apparatus.
3. The Government agrees that this equipment will be installed within
one month of its arrival in Taiwan, and that, within 6 months
thereafter, production of sufficient triple vaccine to maintain
the mass immunization program at the level specified in the Plan
of Operations and the Addendum I thersto will begin, and will be
maintained for as long as is necessary to complete the mass immuni-
zation program. Thereafter sufficient vaccine will be produced
for continued immunization operations as specified in the Plan of
Operations and the Addendum I thereto.
國史饭
Academia Historica

The Government of the Republic of China, hereinafter referred to as "The Government ", and the World Health Organization, hereinafter referred to as " The Organization", and the United Nations Children's Fund, hereinafter referred to as "UNICEF", have agreed to the following Addendum to the Plan of Operations for the Provision of Equipment and Supplies by UNICEF, for the Production of Triple Vaccine in Taiwan Province of the Republic of China to implement a Mass Immunization Campaign against Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis, signed by the Government on 1 June 1953, by the Organization on 18 May 1953, and by UNICEF on 4 May 1953, and to the Addendum I to thet Plan of Operations, signed by the Government on November 1954, by the Organization on November 1954, and by UNICEF on November 1954.

1. On the recommendation of the Organization's expert who inspected the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory, Shihlin, Taipei Hsien, in June 1954, UNICEF has agreed to provide additional equipment for this laboratory, considered to be necessary in order to permit the production of suffi- cient triple vaccine to undertake the mass immunization campaign as set forth in the Plan of Operations, and particularly in the Addendum I thereto. The report of the expert is dated 20 June 1954 and should be read in connection with this Addendum II.
2. In addition to its commitments as set forth in the Plan of Operations, UNICEF will therefore provide the following, up to a value of $13,200 (including $1,200 estimated freight charges) :
Room air conditioners, germicidal lamps, heaters and thermostat unit for incubator room, culture flasks, miscellaneous equipment and chemicals sterilizer, filtering apparatus.

3. The Government agrees that this equipment will be installed within one month of its arrival in Taiwan, and that, within 6 months thereafter, production of sufficient triple vaccine to maintain the mass immunization program at the level specified in the Plan of Operations and the Addendum I thersto will begin, and will be maintained for as long as is necessary to complete the mass immuni- zation program. Thereafter sufficient vaccine will be produced for continued immunization operations as specified in the Plan of Operations and the Addendum I thereto.
